025package com.github.siroshun09.event4j.priority;
026
027import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
028
029/**
030 * An interface to set the listener's priority.
031 * <p>
032 * {@link Priority} is used to determine the order of listener calls.
033 * <p>
034 * {@link Priority} is compared by {@link Integer#compare(int, int)}.
035 * The smaller value, the {@link com.github.siroshun09.event4j.listener.Listener} is called earlier;
036 * the larger value, it is called later.
037 * For the same value, it is not defined which is called first.
038 */
039public interface Priority extends Comparable<Priority> {
040
041    /**
042     * the value of {@link #LOWEST}.
043     * <p>
044     * This is <b>NOT</b> the minimum numeric value that {@link Priority#value(int)} will accept.
045     */
046    int LOWEST_VALUE = -128;
047
048    /**
049     * the value of {@link #LOW}.
050     */
051    int LOW_VALUE = -64;
052
053    /**
054     * the value of {@link #NORMAL}.
055     */
056    int NORMAL_VALUE = 0;
057
058    /**
059     * the value of {@link #HIGH}.
060     */
061    int HIGH_VALUE = 64;
062
063    /**
064     * the value of {@link #HIGHEST}.
065     * <p>
066     * This is <b>NOT</b> the maximum numeric value that {@link Priority#value(int)} will accept.
067     */
068    int HIGHEST_VALUE = 128;
069
070    /**
071     * Priority value: -128
072     */
073    Priority LOWEST = new PriorityImpl(LOWEST_VALUE);
074
075    /**
076     * Priority value: -64
077     */
078    Priority LOW = new PriorityImpl(LOW_VALUE);
079
080    /**
081     * Priority value: 0
082     */
083    Priority NORMAL = new PriorityImpl(NORMAL_VALUE);
084
085    /**
086     * Priority value: 64
087     */
088    Priority HIGH = new PriorityImpl(Priority.HIGH_VALUE);
089
090    /**
091     * Priority value: 128
092     */
093    Priority HIGHEST = new PriorityImpl(Priority.HIGHEST_VALUE);
094
095    /**
096     * Creates a new priority.
097     *
098     * @param value the priority value
099     * @return the priority
100     */
101    static @NotNull Priority value(int value) {
102        return switch (value) {
103            case LOWEST_VALUE -> LOWEST;
104            case LOW_VALUE -> LOW;
105            case NORMAL_VALUE -> NORMAL;
106            case HIGH_VALUE -> HIGH;
107            case HIGHEST_VALUE -> HIGHEST;
108            default -> new PriorityImpl(value);
109        };
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Gets the priority value.
114     *
115     * @return the priority value
116     */
117    int getPriority();
118}
